pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:0.5: 33. The training rule on in order
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six ate almsfood picking here and there. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.3: “‘I will eat almsfood in order,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.4: Almsfood is to be eaten in order.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.5: If a monk eats almsfood picking here and there out of disrespect, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.11: if he picks things out when giving to others;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.12: if he picks things out when putting into someone else’s vessel;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.13: if it is a non-bean curry;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.16: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.17: The third training rule is finished.
